import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

source.a294cb37:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.4f40596b:
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(10,10))
label1=['no','yes']
ax1 = fig.add_subplot(2, 2, 1)
ax2 = fig.add_subplot(2, 2, 2)
ax3 = fig.add_subplot(2, 2, 3)
ax4 = fig.add_subplot(2, 2, 4)
ax1.pie(df.groupby('newcomer')['newcomer'].count(),autopct="%1.1f%%",labels=label1)
ax1.set_title('New Comer')
ax2.pie(df.groupby('ceo_founder')['ceo_founder'].count(),autopct="%1.1f%%",labels=label1)
ax2.set_title('CEO Founder')
ax3.pie(df.groupby('ceo_woman')['ceo_woman'].count(),autopct="%1.1f%%",labels=label1)
ax3.set_title('CEO Women')
ax4.pie(df.groupby('profitable')['profitable'].count(),autopct="%1.1f%%",labels=label1)
ax4.set_title('Profitable')
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
source.05f01b0e:
df_city=pd.DataFrame(df.groupby('city')['city'].count().sort_values(ascending=False).head(30))
df_city=df_city.rename(columns={'city': 'num'})

x = df_city['num']
label = df_city.index
squarify.plot(x, label=label)
plt.axis('off')
plt.show()

source.d758b9d1:
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
le = LabelEncoder()
le = le.fit(df['sector'])
#ラベルを整数に変換
df['sector'] = le.transform(df['sector'])
df.head()
source.02f40774:
df_cluster=df.loc[:,['revenue','profit','num. of employees','sector','Market Cap']]
df_cluster=df_cluster.dropna(subset=['profit'])
pred = KMeans(n_clusters=5).fit_predict(df_cluster)
pred=pd.DataFrame(pred)
df_cluster['cluster']=pred
df_cluster
